author: Tom Olver
title: Timo Werner responds to Liverpool transfer speculation
text:
Liverpool have asked Leipzig about Timo Werner (Picture: Getty) Liverpool target Timo Werner has spoken out following speculation linking him with a transfer move to Anfield in the summer. 
Transfer targets to deadwood: How Arsenal could line up next season amid talk of overhaul The 21-year-old Leipzig forward has scored 14 goals in 22 appearances in the Bundesliga this season but has been linked with a switch to Merseyside in recent weeks.
Reports suggest the Reds have spoken to Leipzig over the availability of Werner but it appears the youngster is focused on developing his game in Germany.
When asked about the recent Liverpool transfer rumours, the striker told Welt am Sonntag: ‘I want to keep growing with RB Leipzig and keep developing here.
Jurgen Klopp has been impressed by Timo Werner this season (Picture: Getty) ‘I am still only 21 years old and still have many years ahead of me.
‘I am very happy at Leipzig and joining this club has been a stroke of luck.

Werner is in Joachim Low’s Germany squad which hosts England at the Westfalenstadion on Wednesday evening.
